attributes.action: Declare results of 2016 referendum void due to electoral offences by Vote Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Vote Leave fined and referred to the police for breaking electoral law:
https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/i-am-a/journalist/electoral-commission-media-centre/party-and-election-finance-to-keep/vote-leave-fined-and-referred-to-the-police-for-breaking-electoral-law

Vote Leave have dropped appeal against Electoral Commission:
https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/mar/29/vote-leave-drops-appeal-against-fine-for-electoral-offences
attributes.background:
The Electoral Commission found Vote Leave broke the electoral rules set out by parliament to ensure fairness, confidence and legitimacy of the referendum. They exceeded legal spending limits by donating hundreds of thousands of pounds to another leave campaign.

The result must be declared void.
